answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Bonnie - yes, I've attached a copy of the City of West Vancouver, BC case study outlinging how they engaged the community by entering into a joint operating agreement with a newly formed non profit society to oversee the operations of a recently constructed $40 million dollar/83,000 square foot community centre officially named the West Vancouver Community Centre, including the oversight of the adjoining 40,000 square foot aquatic centre with a combined operating budget of $6.7 million.
West Vancouver will present the attached case study at the Alliance's annual Transforming Local Goverment conference, June 1-3, 2011 in Clearwater, FL.  This link will take you to the conference website to learn more about the conference http://transformgov.org/en/learning/transforming_local_government
Good luck,
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450
pmuse@transformgov.org

We have a couple that I can think of here in metro Atlanta: ParkPride (www.parkpride.org), which works with the City of Atlanta parks, and the Gwinnett Parks Foundation (www.gwinnettparksfoundation.org), which supports Gwinnett County parks.

author: Bonnie Therrien
text: Does anyone know of any cities or towns that have a non-profit citizens fundraising group that specifically fund raises for the parks in a Town?  Our community, Hebron, CT., started one about a year ago and they are trying to reach out to different communities to see how they have organized themselves; developed capital campaigns; etc.  If you do know of a town or city and perhaps also have a name and contact information for that municipality, that would be great. Bonnie Therrien, Town Manager, Hebron, CT
title: Fundraising Non-Profit Group for Parks
